alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 4:49PM PDT until August 06 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Elko County in northeastern Nevada... * Until 800 PM PDT. * At 449 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.2 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Elko County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
